means: 挑剔，吹毛求疵，找茬儿( carp的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She was in no mood to put up with Blanche's carping.
sentence.Network_cn: 她心情不好，受不了布兰奇的吹毛求疵。

sentence.Network_en: He cannot understand why she's constantly carping at him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不明白为什么她总是找他的茬儿。

sentence.Network_en: European carping over the phraseology represented a mixture of hypocrisy and subterfuge.
sentence.Network_cn: 欧洲在措词上找岔子的做法既虚伪又狡诈.

PerfectNetExp.abs: C开头的单词记忆法（1） - 豆丁网 ... captious adj. 吹毛求疵的；爱挑毛病的＝ carping 吹毛求疵的 【记】 ti 提＋.

中国国家标准汉英翻译青岛雅文翻译公司 ... 青鱼 Black carp 鲢 Silver carp 鳙 Bighead carp.

entry.def: A carp is a kind of fish that lives in lakes and rivers.
If you say that someone is carping, you mean that they keep criticizing or complaining about someone or something, especially in a way you think is unnecessary or annoying.

example.ex: He cannot understand why she's constantly carping at him...
example.tran: 他不明白为什么她总是找他的茬儿。

example.ex: This was the man whom other trainers love to carp about.
example.tran: 这就是老被其他教练挑毛病的那个人。

auth_sentence.content: Instead of carping about what Kepler can or can't do, why can't we say "Look how far we've come", and give the mission a chance?

auth_sentence.content: Reacher fans are already carping online about the choice of the diminutive Mr. Cruise for the role.

auth_sentence.content: CW is never truly shocked by the levels of pinch-faced, slot-eyed carping that the world offers up on a daily basis.
